api/Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjec.title: Namespace Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection
api/Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjec.keywords: Namespace Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection Classes ServiceCollectionExtensions This class contains extension methods related to the Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection type.

api/Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjec.title: Class ServiceCollectionExtensions
api/Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjec.keywords: Class ServiceCollectionExtensions This class contains extension methods related to the Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection type. Inheritance System.Object ServiceCollectionExtensions Inherited Members System.Object.Equals(System.Object) System.Object.Equals(System.Object, System.Object) System.Object.GetHashCode() System.Object.GetType() System.Object.MemberwiseClone() System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object) System.Object.ToString() Namespace : Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection Assembly : CG.Sms.dll Syntax public static class ServiceCollectionExtensions Methods AddSms(IServiceCollection, IConfiguration) This method adds services and strategies for sending sms messages to the specified service collection. Declaration public static IServiceCollection AddSms(this IServiceCollection serviceCollection, IConfiguration configuration) Parameters Type Name Description Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection serviceCollection The service collection to use for the operation. Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration configuration the configuration to use for the operation. Returns Type Description Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection A Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection object for building up an strategies for the service. Remarks This method builds up an sms service using information read from the specified configuration. Here is an example for the JSON configuration: { "Sms": { "Strategy": { "Name": "Twilio", "Assembly": "CG.Sms.Twilio" }, "Twilio": { } } } Let's break it down. The Services section is where ALL services for the application should be configured. If you're adding a CodeGator service to your application then you'll want to add that service to this section in order to configure the service at startup. Under Services , the Sms section is where the CodeGator sms service should be configured. This section contains at least two nodes: Strategy and Assembly . The Strategy node tells the host what strategy to load for the sms service, and as such, is required. The Assembly section is optional, and is only needed when the strategy is located in an external assembly that should be dynamically loaded at startup. The Sms section is an example of a strategy section. This will vary, of course, depending on which strategy is named in the Strategy node. In this case, we see a made up example for a Twilio based SMS strategy. Exceptions Type Condition System.ArgumentException This exception is thrown whenever a required argument is missing or invalid. AddSms(IServiceCollection, Action<ISmsStrategyBuilder>) This method adds services and strategies for sending sms messages to the specified service collection. Declaration public static IServiceCollection AddSms(this IServiceCollection serviceCollection, Action<ISmsStrategyBuilder> builderAction) Parameters Type Name Description Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection serviceCollection The service collection to use for the operation. System.Action < ISmsStrategyBuilder > builderAction The delegate to use for the operation. Returns Type Description Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection A Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection object for building up an strategies for the service. Exceptions Type Condition System.ArgumentException This exception is thrown whenever a required argument is missing or invalid.

api/Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.HostBui.title: Class HostBuilderExtensions
api/Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.HostBui.keywords: Class HostBuilderExtensions This class contains extension methods related to the Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostBuilder type. Inheritance System.Object HostBuilderExtensions Inherited Members System.Object.Equals(System.Object) System.Object.Equals(System.Object, System.Object) System.Object.GetHashCode() System.Object.GetType() System.Object.MemberwiseClone() System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object) System.Object.ToString() Namespace : Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting Assembly : CG.Sms.dll Syntax public static class HostBuilderExtensions Methods AddSms(IHostBuilder) This method adds a standard sms service to the specified host builder. Declaration public static IHostBuilder AddSms(this IHostBuilder hostBuilder) Parameters Type Name Description Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostBuilder hostBuilder The host builder to use for the operation. Returns Type Description Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostBuilder The value of the hostBuilder parameter, for chaining calls together. Remarks The idea with this method, is to create a quick and easy way to setup sms services for a hosted application by following a simple configuration convention. That convention assumes a configuration section exists like this: { "Services" : { "Sms": { "Strategy" : "Twilio", "Assembly" : "CG.Sms.Twilio", "Twilio": { } } } } Let's break it down. The Services section is where ALL services for the application should be configured. If you're adding a CodeGator service to your application then you'll want to add that service to this section in order to configure the service at startup. Under Services , the Sms section is where the CodeGator sms service should be configured. This section contains at least two nodes: Strategy and Assembly . The Strategy node tells the host what strategy to load for the sms service, and as such, is required. The Assembly section is optional, and is only needed when the strategy is located in an external assembly that should be dynamically loaded at startup. The Smtp section is an example of a strategy section. This will vary, of course, depending on which strategy is named in the Strategy node. In this case, we see a made up example for a Twilio based SMS strategy. Exceptions Type Condition System.ArgumentException This exception is thrown whenever one or more of the required parameters is missing or invalid.
